trans-unit.source: Move data from MySQL | Azure Data Factory
trans-unit.target: Move data from MySQL | Azure Data Factory

trans-unit.source: Learn about how to move data from MySQL database using Azure Data Factory.
trans-unit.target: Learn about how to move data from MySQL database using Azure Data Factory.

trans-unit.source: Move data From MySQL using Azure Data Factory
trans-unit.target: Move data From MySQL using Azure Data Factory

trans-unit.source: This article outlines how you can use the Copy Activity in an Azure data factory to move data to from MySQL to another data store.
trans-unit.target: This article outlines how you can use the Copy Activity in an Azure data factory to move data to from MySQL to another data store.

trans-unit.source: This article builds on the <link><linkText>data movement activities</linkText><title></title></link> article which presents a general overview of data movement with copy activity and supported data store combinations.
trans-unit.target: This article builds on the <link><linkText>data movement activities</linkText><title></title></link> article which presents a general overview of data movement with copy activity and supported data store combinations.

trans-unit.source: Data Factory service supports connecting to on-premises MySQL sources using the Data Management Gateway.
trans-unit.target: Data Factory service supports connecting to on-premises MySQL sources using the Data Management Gateway.

trans-unit.source: See <link><linkText>moving data between on-premises locations and cloud</linkText><title></title></link> article to learn about Data Management Gateway and step-by-step instructions on setting up the gateway.
trans-unit.target: See <link><linkText>moving data between on-premises locations and cloud</linkText><title></title></link> article to learn about Data Management Gateway and step-by-step instructions on setting up the gateway.

trans-unit.source: Note: You need to leverage the gateway to connect to MySQL even if it is hosted in Azure IaaS VMs.
trans-unit.target: Note: You need to leverage the gateway to connect to MySQL even if it is hosted in Azure IaaS VMs.

trans-unit.source: If you are trying to connect to an instance of MySQL hosted in cloud, you can also install the gateway instance in the IaaS VM.
trans-unit.target: If you are trying to connect to an instance of MySQL hosted in cloud, you can also install the gateway instance in the IaaS VM.

trans-unit.source: Data factory currently supports only moving data from MySQL to other data stores, but not for moving data from other data stores to MySQL.
trans-unit.target: Data factory currently supports only moving data from MySQL to other data stores, but not for moving data from other data stores to MySQL.

trans-unit.source: For Data Management Gateway to connect to the MySQL Database, you need to install the <link><linkText>MySQL Connector/Net 6.6.5 for Microsoft Windows</linkText><title></title></link> on the same system as the Data Management Gateway.
trans-unit.target: For Data Management Gateway to connect to the MySQL Database, you need to install the <link><linkText>MySQL Connector/Net 6.6.5 for Microsoft Windows</linkText><title></title></link> on the same system as the Data Management Gateway.

trans-unit.source: Sample: Copy data from MySQL to Azure Blob
trans-unit.target: Sample: Copy data from MySQL to Azure Blob

trans-unit.source: A <link><linkText>pipeline</linkText><title></title></link> with Copy Activity that uses <link><linkText>RelationalSource</linkText><title></title></link> and <link><linkText>BlobSink</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: A <link><linkText>pipeline</linkText><title></title></link> with Copy Activity that uses <link><linkText>RelationalSource</linkText><title></title></link> and <link><linkText>BlobSink</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: The sample copies data from a query result in MySQL database to a blob every hour.
trans-unit.target: The sample copies data from a query result in MySQL database to a blob every hour.

trans-unit.source: The JSON properties used in these samples are described in sections following the samples.
trans-unit.target: The JSON properties used in these samples are described in sections following the samples.

trans-unit.source: As a first step, please setup the data management gateway as per the instructions in the <link><linkText>moving data between on-premises locations and cloud</linkText><title></title></link> article.
trans-unit.target: As a first step, please setup the data management gateway as per the instructions in the <link><linkText>moving data between on-premises locations and cloud</linkText><title></title></link> article.

trans-unit.source: The sample assumes you have created a table “MyTable” in MySQL and it contains a column called “timestampcolumn” for time series data.
trans-unit.target: The sample assumes you have created a table “MyTable” in MySQL and it contains a column called “timestampcolumn” for time series data.

trans-unit.source: Setting “external”: ”true” and specifying externalData policy informs the Data Factory service that the table is external to the data factory and not produced by an activity in the data factory.
trans-unit.target: Setting “external”: ”true” and specifying externalData policy informs the Data Factory service that the table is external to the data factory and not produced by an activity in the data factory.

trans-unit.source: Data is written to a new blob every hour (frequency: hour, interval: 1).
trans-unit.target: Data is written to a new blob every hour (frequency: hour, interval: 1).

trans-unit.source: The folder path for the blob is dynamically evaluated based on the start time of the slice that is being processed.
trans-unit.target: The folder path for the blob is dynamically evaluated based on the start time of the slice that is being processed.

trans-unit.source: The folder path uses year, month, day, and hours parts of the start time.
trans-unit.target: The folder path uses year, month, day, and hours parts of the start time.

trans-unit.source: The pipeline contains a Copy Activity that is configured to use the above input and output datasets and is scheduled to run every hour.
trans-unit.target: The pipeline contains a Copy Activity that is configured to use the above input and output datasets and is scheduled to run every hour.

trans-unit.source: In the pipeline JSON definition, the source type is set to RelationalSource and sink type is set to BlobSink.
trans-unit.target: In the pipeline JSON definition, the source type is set to RelationalSource and sink type is set to BlobSink.

trans-unit.source: The SQL query specified for the query property selects the data in the past hour to copy.
trans-unit.target: The SQL query specified for the query property selects the data in the past hour to copy.

trans-unit.source: The following table provides description for JSON elements specific to MySQL linked service.
trans-unit.target: The following table provides description for JSON elements specific to MySQL linked service.

trans-unit.source: The type property must be set to: OnPremisesMySql
trans-unit.target: The type property must be set to: OnPremisesMySql

trans-unit.source: Name of the schema in the database.
trans-unit.target: Name of the schema in the database.

trans-unit.source: Type of authentication used to connect to the MySQL database.
trans-unit.target: Type of authentication used to connect to the MySQL database.

trans-unit.source: Possible values are: Anonymous, Basic, and Windows.
trans-unit.target: Possible values are: Anonymous, Basic, and Windows.

trans-unit.source: Specify user name if you are using Basic or Windows authentication.
trans-unit.target: Specify user name if you are using Basic or Windows authentication.

trans-unit.source: Specify password for the user account you specified for the username.
trans-unit.target: Specify password for the user account you specified for the username.

trans-unit.source: Name of the gateway that the Data Factory service should use to connect to the on-premises MySQL database.
trans-unit.target: Name of the gateway that the Data Factory service should use to connect to the on-premises MySQL database.

trans-unit.source: See <link><linkText>Setting Credentials and Security</linkText><title></title></link> for details about setting credentials for an on-premises MySQL data source.
trans-unit.target: See <link><linkText>Setting Credentials and Security</linkText><title></title></link> for details about setting credentials for an on-premises MySQL data source.

trans-unit.source: For a full list of sections & properties available for defining datasets, see the <link><linkText>Creating datasets</linkText><title></title></link> article. Sections like structure, availability, and policy of a dataset JSON are similar for all dataset types (Azure SQL, Azure blob, Azure table, etc...).
trans-unit.target: For a full list of sections & properties available for defining datasets, see the <link><linkText>Creating datasets</linkText><title></title></link> article. Sections like structure, availability, and policy of a dataset JSON are similar for all dataset types (Azure SQL, Azure blob, Azure table, etc...).

trans-unit.source: The typeProperties section is different for each type of dataset and provides information about the location of the data in the data store.
trans-unit.target: The typeProperties section is different for each type of dataset and provides information about the location of the data in the data store.

trans-unit.source: The typeProperties section for dataset of type RelationalTable (which includes MySQL dataset) has the following properties
trans-unit.target: The typeProperties section for dataset of type RelationalTable (which includes MySQL dataset) has the following properties

trans-unit.source: Name of the table in the MySQL Database instance that linked service refers to.
trans-unit.target: Name of the table in the MySQL Database instance that linked service refers to.

trans-unit.source: For a full list of sections & properties available for defining activities, see the <link><linkText>Creating Pipelines</linkText><title></title></link> article. Properties like name, description, input and output tables, various policies etc. are available for all types of activities.
trans-unit.target: For a full list of sections & properties available for defining activities, see the <link><linkText>Creating Pipelines</linkText><title></title></link> article. Properties like name, description, input and output tables, various policies etc. are available for all types of activities.

trans-unit.source: Properties available in the typeProperties section of the activity on the other hand vary with each activity type and in case of Copy activity they vary depending on the types of sources and sinks.
trans-unit.target: Properties available in the typeProperties section of the activity on the other hand vary with each activity type and in case of Copy activity they vary depending on the types of sources and sinks.

trans-unit.source: In case of Copy Activity when source is of type RelationalSource (which includes MySQL) the following properties are available in typeProperties section:
trans-unit.target: In case of Copy Activity when source is of type RelationalSource (which includes MySQL) the following properties are available in typeProperties section:

trans-unit.source: Use the custom query to read data.
trans-unit.target: Use the custom query to read data.

trans-unit.source: As mentioned in the <link><linkText>data movement activities</linkText><title></title></link> article, Copy activity performs automatic type conversions from source types to sink types with the following 2 step approach:
trans-unit.target: As mentioned in the <link><linkText>data movement activities</linkText><title></title></link> article, Copy activity performs automatic type conversions from source types to sink types with the following 2 step approach:

trans-unit.source: Convert from native source types to .NET type
trans-unit.target: Convert from native source types to .NET type

trans-unit.source: Convert from .NET type to native sink type
trans-unit.target: Convert from .NET type to native sink type

trans-unit.source: When moving data to MySQL the following mappings will be used from MySQL types to .NET types.
trans-unit.target: When moving data to MySQL the following mappings will be used from MySQL types to .NET types.
